perturbation.original_text: "Gross Revenues" means the gross revenues received by the Licensee and derived from or in connection with the Licensee Site, from any sources whatsoever, including but not limited to fees for access to and use of the Licensee Site and advertising, sponsorship, marketing and other paid-for placements, andmaintenance, support and other services.
perturbation.changed_text: "Gross Revenues" means the gross revenues received by the Licensee and derived solely from fees charged directly for access to and use of the Licensee Site. It explicitly excludes revenues from advertising, sponsorship, marketing and other paid-for placements, and maintenance, support and other services.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Gross Revenues' includes income from various sources. The modified definition restricts it to only fees for access and use of the Licensee Site. This creates ambiguity about whether to calculate Royalties on all revenues or just a portion.

perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall use the Marks solely in accordance with Licensor's trademark usage guidelines and quality control standards as the same may be updated from time to time by Licensor. If Licensor notifies Licensee that any use does not so comply, Licensee shall immediately either remedy the use to the satisfaction of Licensor or terminate such use. Licensee shall not use, register or attempt to register in any jurisdiction any Mark that is confusingly similar to or incorporates any of the Licensor's Marks. All uses of the Licensor's Marks, and all goodwill associated therewith, shall inure solely to the benefit of Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee may use the Marks in accordance with its own reasonable interpretation of trademark law, provided that such use does not demonstrably harm the reputation of Licensor. If Licensor notifies Licensee that any use does not so comply, Licensee will consider modifying its use, but is not obligated to do so. Licensee shall not use, register or attempt to register in any jurisdiction any Mark that is identical to the Licensor's Marks. All goodwill generated by Licensee's use of the Licensor's Marks shall be jointly owned by Licensor and Licensee.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates strict adherence to Licensor's guidelines. The changed text allows Licensee's own interpretation and weakens the obligation to remedy non-compliance. This creates conflict regarding the control and ownership of the trademarks and associated goodwill.

perturbation.original_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement, effective upon written notice to the other party, if the other partymaterially breaches this Agreement, and such breach is incapable of cure or, if capable of cure, (i) fails to commence a plan of action approved by Licensor to cure such breach within thirty (30) days, or (ii) fails to cure such breach within ninety (90) days after receiving written notice thereof, in either case after receiving notice of the breach. Provided, however, that if the breach giving rise to the termination right under this Section 6.2is non-payment of License Fees or Royalties, the cure period shall be ten (10) days.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement, effective upon written notice to the other party, if the other party breaches any term of this Agreement, regardless of materiality. The breaching party shall have thirty (30) days to cure any breach, regardless of whether the breach is curable. There is no specific cure period for non-payment of License Fees or Royalties; all breaches are treated equally.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause distinguishes between material and non-material breaches and provides a shorter cure period for non-payment. The modified clause eliminates the materiality requirement, applies a uniform cure period to all breaches, and removes the expedited cure for payment defaults, creating conflict and uncertainty.
